benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered: Valid Payload: Happy-path creation with required header, optional headers, and multiple fields (TC01–TC05).
Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON (TC08), missing required properties (TC16), unexpected fields (TC06), and empty array handling (TC07).
Validation: paymentId UUID format (TC10), unsupported query params (TC17), and required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header presence (TC01, TC09).
Large Payloads: Near-limit payload and 201/413 behavior (TC15).
Concurrency: Concurrent POSTs to the same payment without data loss (TC19).
Security: SQLi/XSS inputs sanitized or rejected (TC14) and Unicode handling (TC21).
Performance/Resiliency: Latency/timeout handling (TC18) and performance under normal/peak load (TC22–TC23).
Integration/Persistence: Created fields retrievable via GET and consistent across systems (TC24–TC25).
Optional Headers: X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment accepted (TC02).
Story ACs: 201 success with JSON array (TC01), 400 on invalid input (TC08, TC10, TC16), 404 when payment not found (TC11).
gaps: Server Error Handling: No explicit test for 500 Internal Server Error on backend failures (only 503 covered in TC13).
Duplicate Submission/Idempotency: No scenario re-sending the exact same POST to ensure graceful handling (e.g., 201 once, then 200/409 or no-op).
Consumes/Content-Type: No negative test for missing or wrong Content-Type leading to 415 Unsupported Media Type.
Batch Atomicity: No test for mixed valid and invalid CustomField items in one array to define all-or-nothing vs partial success behavior.
Response Headers: No assertions that the 201 response includes Content-Type: application/json (and any expected headers).
Authorization 403: No scenario for authenticated user lacking permissions (forbidden).
Field Constraints: No boundary tests for fieldName/fieldValue length, allowed characters, or maximum number of fields per request.
Auditability: No verification that X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment values are persisted/audited as expected.

Duplicate Keys vs Existing Data: No explicit test for posting a field whose name already exists on the payment (update vs reject vs allow alongside) beyond general coexistence (TC04) and duplicates within the same request (TC20).
recommendations: Add a scenario simulating an internal server error (e.g., DB exception) and expect HTTP 500 with an error payload.
Introduce an idempotency/duplicate submission test: send the same POST twice and assert desired behavior (201 then 200/204/409 or deduped 201).
Add a negative test for missing/incorrect Content-Type to assert HTTP 415 Unsupported Media Type.
Create a mixed-validity batch test: one invalid CustomField among valid ones; define and assert atomic (fail all) or partial success semantics and error shape.
Assert response headers on success: Content-Type: application/json (and any Location/Audit headers if applicable).
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for a user who is authenticated but lacks permission to add custom fields.
Add boundary tests for CustomField schema: max/min lengths for fieldName/fieldValue, allowed charset, and maximum array size beyond payload size alone.
Verify audit persistence: after POST with X-Killbill-Reason/Comment, fetch audit/logs or metadata to confirm they are recorded.
Add a scenario for posting a CustomField whose name already exists on the payment to confirm expected behavior (overwrite, reject with 409/400, or allow duplicate).
